conclusion: To determine the temperature of the gas at state B, we can use the ideal gas law and the properties of the processes involved.
From state A to state B, the volume remains constant (VA = VB).
The ideal gas law is PV = nRT, where P is pressure, V is volume, n is the number of moles, R is the gas constant, and T is temperature.
